intro: Anemia spicantoides, commonly known as the spiky anemia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Anemia spicantoides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has been used traditionally in some regions for its purported medicinal properties.
